instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Doesn't turn on without charger. After turning on with a charger connected, when disconnected from the charger works perfectly on battery. Any ideas?
Thanks guys.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Battery recognized in OSX and condition reported as "normal"?
What is the voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with the charger connected and battery disconnected?
Was this liquid spill?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Thanks for replying. The board has experienced water damage, was ultrasonic cleaned and shows no visible signs of oxidation. Battery is recognized in OS X and shows no faulty alert.
Measured voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with the charger connected and battery disconnected is 6.7-7.3 V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: Do I need to point out that your battery is dead?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message: It's not, we have tested it with different all working batteries

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b
threads.message:
Sorry I thought I read the battery did report a fault.
Seems to me this may be the sense resistors around <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52/21/22 or the traces. PPBUS on adapter without battery should be 8.4V
